A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Wow.. Just wow. Who decided to let Rian Johnson\, a man with only a handful of credits to his name\, write AND direct a 300 million dollar movie. Disney and Johnson opted to break from all canon from the original movies (except fan service like AT-ATs) and create a disjointed mess of a movie.  Tone\, humor\, pacing\, character development and plot were non-existent. The well established rules of the Star Wars universe were broken repeatedly for purposes of lazy writing and deus ex machina. The characters never had any struggles\, and were in the same place at the end of the movie 2.5 hours later\, except Luke.. who died for no explainable reason. I could continue for another few thousand words about how much of a shit show this movie is\, but instead I'll just say\, as a movie it is 2/5. As a Star Wars movie with seven films of setup behind it\, it is a -20/5.Wow.. Just wow.
